channel.title: Should I take this offer?
channel.description:
I posted a picture of something I made to reddit recently, [img width=300 height=200]http://i.imgur.com/kTmFZ.jpg[/img] And got a message hours later with this offer.
Hi, I left a message about whether you do Freelance work. I'm a Video Producer for Yell in the UK (yellow pages) and I produce videos for our top end video product (Premium Video) http://marketing.yell.com/products/video/premium/ As well as producing them, I manage the product, but am always looking for talented artists like yourself who can do great work...what are your rates? Jamie Morden
I'm not sure if this guy's legit or not, but on the chance that he is I don't want to pass up an opportunity like this. I'm considering accepting, but I'm not sure yet. Should I take the offer?

item.title: Should I take this offer?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

Yell is a big company, if he’s for real I would take the oppotunity, you have nothing to loose.

Read full topic

ah i see it now…

Title = Daginith’s Book to Success
[/quote]
ah. I see it also. A book with forbidden grammar… ahh[/quote]

ah, i didnt even PUBLISH it yet, and i have the grammer police on my ass. XD

Read full topic

item.title: Should I take this offer?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:14, topic:431557”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=534235.msg3905904#msg3905904 date=1328226777]

I get this shit all the time, on these forums, taleworlds, and polycount. I very seldom waste my time on projects obviously going no where because I want them to not waste their time either.

Well I plan on going to college for graphic design, and at some point make a career out of it, so this would be a good experience.

Plus, you know, fucking money. The most money I’ve had in the past month is like, 8 dollars.
[/quote]

l2makesandwhichesforlunchandstilltakeyourparentsmoneytheygiveyouforlunch Noob[/quote]

or he could use this math equation:

free time + bar + drinks(4) = chicks
1 chick + kitchen = infinite sanwiches

sell the sandwiches to your friends,
since the sandwiches never run out,
you can have infinate sandwiches + infinate money

and we all know:

 infinite sandwiches + infinate money = success

keeping that in mind, you dont even need to wory about getting a job. you’ll be rich and never be hungry!!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:10, topic:431557”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=534235.msg3905798#msg3905798 date=1328223156]
Totally should, you lucky thing. At least reply enquiring further detail anyway.
[/quote]
What kind of things should I ask?[/quote]

ask about him about the company. find out if he is legit, or a scammer making you do stuff for free, then selling it, saying that he did it, because you have no leagl rights to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I take this offer?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:431557”]Worst case scenario they find out you’re underage and you have no legal rights to payment even after giving them the work, because of the legal working age

In other words, if you’re going to do it, make sure you grab something legally binding besides normal work paperwork, because that wont work (and you live in different countries, not sure what effect that has)[/quote]
I don’t think those things would apply in a situation like this because it’s not a legal occupation, it would be me selling my work for a small price.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I take this offer?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

could do freelance shit and they pay by the result

Read full topic

item.title: Should I take this offer?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Worst case scenario they find out you’re underage and you have no legal rights to payment even after giving them the work, because of the legal working age

In other words, if you’re going to do it, make sure you grab something legally binding besides normal work paperwork, because that wont work (and you live in different countries, not sure what effect that has)

I guess another bad thing would be if you couldn’t do what he asked, but who knows? There’s always the possibility he just pays you through paypal too or whatever, assuming he is an honorable man.

Read full topic
